as he pours a pail of water over his head, it runs down his face in slow motion.

a few yards away.   Nick smiles, then walks into the store, hoping he hasn't been made.

dropping another cigarette butt to the ground.  There's a small pile at his feet.  He's leaning against the wall watching one end of the block.  TRACK over to reveal Ich, his back to Nick's, watching the other end.

who slams the side of Kobo's head with the butt of his gun.
can't believe Sugai's going to kill him.  Nick starts to get up, Ich stops him.

rises from a ditch and swings a hoe at the rider as he passes, catching the man across the face.  The rider drops like a swatted fly.  The biker's momentum carries it a few yards before it falls and skids to a halt.
dumps the bike at the foot of the stairs and leaps on Kobo.
tackles her, and wrestles the gun away.  She grabs for it.
comes around the same corner.  His bike fishtails and slides out from under him.
pulling eight-five... ninety... one hundred.  The rain stings his face.  It's hard to keep his eye open.
is gaining on him.  He HEARS something coming up behind him.
swerves to avoid it at the last moment.  The biker reacts too late and runs --
burst around the corner charging toward him at a hundred-
struggling to get his gun.  Finally he does.  But it's caked in mud.  If the barrel is stuffed it will explode.
aims as best he can and fires.  The mud caked gun explodes in his hand.  Nick screams in agony.
struggles to get up.  He can't.
crawling a few inches, that's it.
reaches into his coat and pulls Ich's 18 inch shuto out.
mustering all his strength, struggles across the road on all fours.
still moving, his arms and legs feel like lead.

grabs Kobo's wrist forcing him to drop the plate.  Nick picks up a rock.  It looks as if he's going to smash Kobo's head.  Instead, he brings it down on the plate, shattering it in a half-dozen pieces.
standing at the far end of the room by the fuse box.  He's also bandaged and on crutches.

I see the deuce, and one to chase them home.

his hand close around the grip of the Beretta.  He unsnaps the ankle holster.  The SNAP can be heard across the room.

They say we got to turn around and come right back.  That's what they say.  I got a plan.
I call, right?  I say I got the dreaded thirty six-hour Asian shits from some raw clam and we stretch it into three days.  You and I become a driving force on the local Geisha scene.
Hey, come on, big guy like you, cop from New York.  You're gonna be the biggest thing to hit town since Godzilla.
Says here, it's very impolite to touch someone while you're talking to them...
Guess that means you can't talk and screw at the same time, huh, hotdog?
Where is the subway station, please.
Nick, have I been a good partner?
I just want you to know... I mean anybody who says you ever took has got to deal with me.

Food... Food, here we go.  Tokyo offers a wide variety of food.  It's best to sample the local specialties, including sashaimi, soba, and world renown Kobe beef...
The back room at Lombardi's after the Columbus Day Parade.  Under the bed.  In the mayor's office.

My partner and I are cops.
We're on a very big assignment here.
... He's a sorry old guy, but I like him.

Imagine a small, greasy Boy Scout.
wears tortoise shell shades.  He coolly checks out the room then nods to --
We see his eyes first as he steps out of the darkness at the back of the alley.  From now on we'll call him KOBO.
who pulls a Spas 12, automatic shotgun from under his coat, and spits out three rounds.  A window shatters.
covers the floor.  Abolofia's bodyguards show their empty hands.
levels the scattergun at Nick and Charlie.
on the floor.  They don't have the artillery for this guy either.
trying to shove past the customs inspectors who are wrestling them aside.
He was with a friend, sure.  I shake hands with the guy and a minute later he's bleeding all over my socks.
Hard to believe a trained police officer could let this kind of thing happen right in front of his face.
Cheer up, Nick.  I'm sure it's easier to pick a dead man's pocket.
reaches for a gun under his coat.  But NUMBER TWO pumps two rounds into his face.  At this range, there's not much left.

swings slowly back and forth from three stories up.  Nick cautiously moves down the alley, holding the gun in both hands.  A Junkie steps out of a doorway, Nick swings his gun and nearly blows him away.
stop at the end of the alley.  FOUR OFFICERS climb out.
How big a package we talking about?
The old man was a Japanese paper manufacturer.  Hotel room and rental car were full of it.
Art and stationary paper.  Cavello had five hundred thousand in his attache case.
One guy do all the damage?
Thought you knew your way around dark alleys, detective.
Doesn't speak a word of English.
He's wanted in Japan.  They want him first.  Then we can have him.
Japanese embassy talks to state department.  State talks to police plaza.  They to me and me to you.
You and Charlie are taking the Jap home, tonight.
Check your gun before you leave.
They said send a detective if I could spare one.
... Remember, counterfeiting is the Feds.  They'll be all over Abolofia's place.  Stick tight.

... The old man's suit was Japanese.
There's something you got to see.

the Japanese killer who smashed in Nick's face last night.
his eyes still on Nick, drops Charlie in front of the speeding express as if he were a sack of laundry.

... But you can take care of yourself.  You're 'the biggest thing to hit this town since Godzilla.'  Nick glances at the guards, then back at Kobo.  He is unarmed.  To make a move would be suicide.  More POLICE SIRENS in the b.g. closing in.
What's the matter.  I'm right in front of you, Nick.
But I was right in front of you when you let Charlie die.
Walk away again.  Maybe you'll get used to it.
standing alone in the middle of a tatami room.  His face is badly beaten.  His hands are bound.  Two guards stand near the wall.  Nick and Ich stand across the room.
stares defiantly at Sugai.  He doesn't even wince as the blade slices off his finger.  The guard hands Sugai the finger in a handkerchief.
Ugly... A couple of thousand years they've been bound by these little rules.  Looking in.  Always afraid.
You are a lucky man.  Where you come from a man can stand out.  It's expected.  Here a man is made to look a fool for standing out.
I like your friend, Joyce.  You're lucky.
She's such a long way home for you.
I want the plate from your pal, Sugai.  When you get it, you get her.
gets to his feet.  The biker tosses Kobo the rifle.  Kobo works the charging lever and holds the weapon at his side.
There's nothing you can do for me anymore.  I have the plate.  Sugai's dead.  No there is something.
You can tell me who I should shoot first.
the shooter, is holding a pistol -- a Glock 17 automatic.
continues firing as he climbs onto a motorcycle.  He pops the clutch and flies off down the road.  Nick fires after him, but Kobo's gone.
waits and waits.  Nick draws closer.  Then, Kobo tears off back down the mountain, shooting past Nick.
pulls his bike up inches in front of Nick's head.  Nick seems to be bleeding everywhere:  his hand, his nose, his mouth, the side of his head...
screams in pain.  He tries to stop too suddenly.  The bike flips over.  Kobo flies into the air then hits the pavement on his side and rolls a few yards down the road.
crawls toward it on his belly.
If you will please give this to the customs inspector he will expidate -- expedite you.  We have a car and a driver outside.
You must get in line behind the rest.
You lost a man we wanted for some time.  It was very incompetent on your part, officer.
Do you know what this is?
It's a laundry list.  Go home, detective.
Why don't you ask your chief detective?
The young are eating the old, something that usually doesn't happen here.
There's a war, detective, between two rival groups.  The man who escaped, Kobo, leads the younger group.  They did this.
Excellent, Officer Matsumoto.  How is your investigation going?
He's an officer of great distinction.
Have you changed your mind and decided to go home, detective?
... You ignored me.  I don't care about what you want.  Get on a plane, detective Conklin.  Go home.
Your visa has expired.  Be on a plane in twenty-four hours or you will be deported.
You ruined an on-going investigation that could have gotten us more than one runner.
I want a full report in the morning, officer.
Your plane leaves at six.  Two officers will escort you.
-- Do you know where she is, detective?  Do you know how to find her?  Even where to start?  We will find them.
is at his desk studying a report.
Inspector Ohashi will take charge of the prisoner.
Detective Ichiro Matsumoto.  I'm the man you're looking for.
The man you are looking for, Kobo, was a member of the Samaguchi-gummi.
Where would you look for the mafia?
The mayor's office, under the bed, the back room at Lombardi's.
No, this is the place for the young Yakuza.
I love you people.  The music, the clothes, the movies... Japanese respect only what is Japanese.

Americans change everything.  When I was young the city was wood and paper... I was ten when the bombers came.  I lived underground for three days.  When I came up, the city was gone... A ball of fire.
It began to rain, Nick.  You know what color the rain was?
Black... It was black from the ash.
You should be nicer to my American friends, Joyce.
That I should let you pay for the drinks.
... We got to keep looking.  Track him down!  Great balls of fire!
There's been a murder.  Yakuza.  You should come.
Kobo's a wild boy.  He was a lieutenant in the Sammaguchi-gummi.
Well, sir.  Thank you for giving me the opportunity to work with these distinguished gentlemen.
following in his wake.  He bows and apologizes to the offended.
seated at a low table looking at him from across the room.
They made you leave your hotel...
It may be too soon to talk about it.
I couldn't keep up.  My shame is complete.
I'll get him for you, Nick.
Ich watching Nick through the window from inside his apartment.  He glances back and sees Charlie's "Members Only" coat hanging on a hook.
I've continued working on the case!
Kobo has disappeared.  My superiors don't trust me.
Kobo's.  Taken off him when he was arrested in New York.
I knew you'd come back.  You feel you have a debt you can never pay.
We can ask someone I used to work with.  A criminal.  Someone I pay money to...
He says they're very nice.  He wants to know if you have anymore.
This man must be treated with respect.
Nick, no one's seen Kobo in three days.  He might not even be in Tokyo.
slurping his noodles.  It is considered polite to slurp soba noodles as loud as possible.

I'm a joke.  They sent you to me to make a fool of you.

Don't say anything more.  Don't do anything.  And, for Christ's sake, don't apologize!

I have to piss, gentlemen... I'm so sorry but I have to --
Kobo is inside.  He's with Sugai, the head of the Summaguchi-clan.
... A Godfather.  His man was killed at the printing plant.

No.  I won't put myself in danger for you anymore.
carrying a gift wrapped package under his arm.  He's wearing his hat, blue suit and tie.
For Sugai.  Caviar, French cheese, ham... If you come to apologize for interrupting his meeting, Sugai may feel obligated to see you.
You don't know what you're doing.
I called Ohashi, he'll be waiting.
I'll tell you one thing.  You can't solve a thing sitting on your ass.
I followed them.  An hour from the train station.
You know, Nick, we can't lose.
Because we're the biggest things to hit this town since Godzilla.
stands his ground as the bike closes in.  The biker takes aim.

appears behind Kobo and takes him down with an amazing display of baton work that shows a lifetime of training.
walking toward him down the long aisle, his left arm is bandaged, his right hand handcuffed to Kobo on crutches.
stops in front of the desk and snaps to attention.
Constable Ichiro Matsumoto presents captured prisoner Kobo, Chief Inspector Ohashi.
sitting at a desk, thumbing through a Frommer's guide to New York City.  Nick drops one of the vests on the desk.
You wouldn't make it without me.
How can you be so sure?
He gets as much as he wants.
Right when you're being tucked into bed.
An outside person.  A foreigner.  A barbarian.  You, me.
You have a helluva way of asking for help.
Look, you need Ich.  I've been here five years and I still can't read all the street signs.
She ever pull down her shades?
Somebody must be suffering somewhere, you're being so nice.
I've heard of Sugai.  I've also heard of the emperor.  They're both national treasures.  One's a hood.
You're wrong to sell Ich short.
His son hooked up with some bikers.
A father doesn't out live that kind of thing here, much less a police officer...
The woman in the apartment.  She won't speak to him.  But she won't leave either.  Japan... Nice, huh?
I'd invite you up but I know you'd hate the incense.
'Nam oyo ranged kyo.'  You think it's dumb of course.
This little guy thinks you're Robert Redford... the other one thinks you're Charles Bronson...
All's not lost.  There's a famous temple here.  We could chant.
You came up with the first part.
You're out of your mind.  I'm leaving.
Bullshit, Nick.  And don't tell me this is all just about Charlie.
I still think you're a bastard.
standing at the top of the steps.  A biker is pressing the muzzle of a Sig-Saur assault rifle on her.  Kobo's girl is beside them holding a small pistol.

Maybe.  If I come visit, we can find out.
You don't speak the language.  I'll drop him off.
on their multi-cylinder high tech street bombers, creep around the corner and slowly ride toward Nick and Charlie.
quietly gives an order.  Someone turns off the robotic.
Looking for clues in the bottom of a sake bottle, Matsumoto?
-- Nick barreling through the mass of faceless Salarymen.
asleep, the futon tangled around him.  He opens his eyes.

waiting in the restaurant, get up to follow.
watching in a doorway down the block.  Nick's shivering, his hands thrust in his army surplus jacket.  Ich doesn't mind the cold.  He's had his sake.
making their way through the waist high water.
raise the heavy bike.  Nick mounts.  He takes the riders helmet and goggles from Ich, and puts them on.
riding their bikes come around the corner drive past her, then circle back.
are having a heated discussion.  The GIRL Ich and Nick have been following walks over to Kobo and sits beside him.  This makes Sugai even more irate.  He's on his feet, red faced and screaming.
seeing Ich, pull out their Beretta's.  Two more grab him and fling him head first against the wall.
are standing across the street waiting for the cops to arrive.
from either end of the street peel around the corner.
Pick it up.  Look at it.
Seven years work by the finest engraver.  Mass produced, sequentially numbered.  The best there has ever been, Mr. Conklin.
-- Kobo... I know.  He killed two of my partners.  One in New York, one at the printing plant.

I took Kobo from the street.  I gave him a home, a future... But my ways were too slow for him... I served seven years in prison for my boss when I was a young man.  Kobo wouldn't serve seven minutes for his Oyabun.
He was supposed to take over this syndicate when I retired.
Our associates in New York were close to closing a deal with us.
Yes.  Unlike our syndicates, your criminals don't understand the words 'honor' and 'duty'... We can't afford not to deal with them.
Imagine if your families could pay their gambling and drug debts with perfect counterfeit bought for cents on the dollar.
Not with these bills.  And even if it only took them six months, do you know what our profit margin would be?
The other plate is currently in New York, in the hands of Kobo's man.
You're smarter than Kobo.  You know the price of deceit.  Think about it.
Kobo will meet me here tomorrow.
He'll find out you took me.  I'm unprotected.  He'll kill us.  All of us.  You don't stand a chance.
wearing his hat and coat is sitting on the couch, his back to us, facing out the window.
wearing a western suit, is asking Kobo questions in Japanese.  Sugai barks at him again.  Kobo refuses to answer.  Sugai pulls up a shuto -- an 18 inch knife --
Contact your associate in New York and tell him to hand my plate over to Abolofia.
You have betrayed the syndicate and personally dishonored me.  I would rather the deal fell through than...
Abolofia's person has received the plate.  It's done.
I wanted you to see him like this.
If anything happens to Abolofia or my plate, detective...
stop in front of every door long enough to blast into the room.  They make their way down the hall.
with their hoes make their way into the water.  They don't see our cops.
making their way along the edge of the road.  The SOUND of a motorcycle coming.

Saddle up.  Hard team in the first unit.  Conklin, your RMP awaits.
